alert.note: Alert for Adams; Arapahoe; Elbert; Lincoln; Washington (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 01 at 7:28PM MDT until May 01 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: The National Weather Service in Denver Colorado has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Elbert County in east central Colorado... Eastern Arapahoe County in northeastern Colorado... Southwestern Washington County in northeastern Colorado... Southeastern Adams County in northeastern Colorado... North central Lincoln County in east central Colorado... * Until 800 PM MDT. * At 728 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 5 miles east of Shamrock to near Agate, or along a line extending from 25 miles south of Fort Morgan to 19 miles northwest of Limon, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Hail damage to vehicles is expected. * Locations impacted include... Cottonwood Valley and Last Chance. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
